answer: From the beginning of my education Miss Sullivan made it a practice to speak to me as she would speak to any hearing child; the only difference was that she spelled the sentences into my hand instead of speaking them\.

query: What did Miss Sullivan do when I didn’t know the words and idioms necessary to express my thoughts?
answer: If I did not know the words and idioms necessary to express my thoughts she supplied them, even suggesting conversation when I was unable to keep up my end of the dialogue\.

query: How long did the learning process continue with Miss Sullivan?
answer: This process was continued for several years; for the deaf child does not learn in a month, or even in two or three years, the numberless idioms and expressions used in the simplest daily intercourse\.

query: How does the little hearing child learn?
answer: The little hearing child learns these from constant repetition and imitation\.
